reviews.text: Just phoned to hotel to make a reservation, only to be told 'call me in ten minutes I am now very busy'. Needless to say I will NOT be phoning back. They do not deserve mine or anybody else's business. Avoid!
reviews.title: Never go there

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very venetian in design but absolutely nice and a mordern toilet...all you need. Its in alley and we missed it coming....but simply ask locals. Close to manin square and supermarkets and rialto. You have to carry your bags as there are no lifts. Also cross the rilato and eat on that side as its cheaper..you will see. Hotel staff quite nice....
reviews.title: Nice clean hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Was not expecting too much from this hotel as it is only rated 3 stars but overall exceeded all our expectations.
reviews.title: Fantastic location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fantastic location- only a 500m walk from Rialto Bridge and a 5 minute walk from San Marco Square.
reviews.title: Great location and a good hotel

reviews.text: The only downfalls about this hotel was that there is no elevator so we had to carry all our luggage up 3 flights of stairs (although understandable as there was a lack of space within the hotel), we had booked a room with a double bed but they were in fact two separate single beds pushed together, public areas were extremely hot due to the lack of air conditioners and the bathroom had a very small shower space.
reviews.title: Will never stay anywhere else - FABULOUSS

reviews.text: I stayed at the Centauro Hotel prior to boarding a cruise out of Venice. The directions to the hotel from the website are somewhat confusing, but once you find the route, the location is about 5 minutes from San Marco Square and equal distance from the Rialto Bridge....very convenient to some of the main must-see sites! A landmark for the hotel is the Campo Manin. There are several great restaurants and shops in the area and the square is a great place to relax. There are three floors and no elevator, so you will need to bring your luggage up the stairs. They provide a very nice breakfast and can provide great recommendations for lunch and dinner.
reviews.title: Hotel with Great Location and Wonderful Service
Cosy Little hotel
reviews.text: Excellent hotel in the heart of venice close to Piazza San Marco. Very good value for money with excellent breakfast, comfortable and nicely decorated bedroom and bathroom and helpful reception staff.

I spent a week at the Hotel Centauro in July 2013. If you follow the directions provided upon booking its not difficult to fine, and the location is great - tucked between Rialto and San Marco but not on a busy tourist way. The staff were very warm and friendly, and breakfast spread pretty good.
reviews.title: A perfect little home in Venice

reviews.text: My single room was exactly what I was after. Cosy, clean and quiet. While the window looked into a side alley it was perfect to open during afternoon siesta time and hear the gondaleers singing as they drifted past (to the couple who were getting very angry at the night reception when they didnt get the room with a view they wanted - lighten up - your in Venice, lifes good, get out and explore!!!!).
reviews.title: Good hotel in the heart of Venezia

reviews.text: I'd definately stay here again.
reviews.title: hard to find but worth the trouble

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although we had trouble navigating the city (despite having been there before) we had no trouble finding the hotel once we were in the square, thanks to a fellow reviewer stating it was hard to find...!! (look for the little sign down the alleyway!!) The room was SPECTACULAR, with THREE balconies overlooking a canal, and 20ft ceilings! we felt like royalty staying here! The buffet breakfast was very good with a great variety of items, and the location was perfect for exploring the city! We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the hotel and would recommend it to anyone!
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel!

reviews.text: This hotel is so central to the Rialto bridge and st marks. It was lovely and quaint just by a canal and just off a square. We booked with booking.com and got a great rate. The room felt very Venetian in its decor and whilst the bathroom was small it was functional. The breakfast selection was great in a room which overlooked the canal. Definitely great value for such a brilliant location - everything was no more than 5-10 min walk.
reviews.title: Fantastic boutique hotel with all the charm of Venice

reviews.text: A little gem of a hotel, on a quiet side street. Away from all the hustle and bustle of Venice, and yet central enough to be at San Marco within a 5 minute walk. The staff were friendly and helpful, and gave me directions and restuarant recommendations.
reviews.title: Nice little hotel

reviews.text: The breakfast was very basic, but at such a great price that wasn't an issue at all.
reviews.title: A little hard to find

reviews.text: My room was lovely and clean with fab Venetian decor.
reviews.title: Nice stay at Centuaro Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Recently stayed 2 nights here on vacation. First of all, print the pdf off their website with the map of directions to the hotel. Once you have that, it's very easy to find the hotel, from either the Rialto bridge or from St. Mark's square. Less than 5 min walk to Rialto bridge. Around 10 min walk to St. Mark's Square. Could not believe how great the location of this hotel was. Hotel itself was very old-school, old furnishings, shabby furniture. We could deal with this though since location was so good and we somehow got a good deal. No lift, but we didn't mind going up two flights of stairs with our minimal luggage. The breakfast was a highlight: fresh brewed coffee, croissants, deli meats and cheeses and rolls, yogurts, cereals, watery juices, and a hot quiche-quesadilla type item, which was good. Nice canal view from the terrace of breakfast room. One free wifi hour included, which came in handy for checking flights before we left. Would definitely stay here again. Location, location, location!
reviews.title: Great location, good breakfast

reviews.text: This hotel has a very good location close to Rialto bridge . Located on a small street like most other hotels in Venice , not easy to find . But with a map on your phone you will manage :) rooms small but in authentic style , clean . Staff very helpful ! Internet avaliable , first hour free, and later 5EUR/10 hours or 10 EUR/24/hrs - so very reasonable :) best thing is breakfast . Ok selection but the restaurant looks like dining room at the grandparents place . Very nice with a tarrace going out to one of the canals . Place not that cheap but still reasonable compared to others places in Venice :)
reviews.title: Very cosy and good location ... Not easy to find ;)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second trip to Venice and we decided to splurge for a room w/canal view. It was simply wonderful and a stay right out of a storybook! From reading the other reviews it is apparent to me that choosing the right room, and being willing to pay a bit more, makes all the difference at this hotel. Our room was located above a side canal and directly above the beautiful, flowered balcony off the breakfast room. The view was quintessential Venice and every evening we were serenaded by the singing gondoliers passing beneath our large, shuttered windows that opened fully allowing a spectacular view. The room was extremely large and decorated with old world charm and comfort. Queen size bed, full size sofa, amoire, desk/chair, sitting chair and small refrigerator...plus room to spare. The bath was adequate and clean and the shower larger than most European hotels offer. There was no tub, but not an issue for us. Yes, there was no elevator but being in Venice you must walk everywhere so toting large or many suitcases is not advisable anyway. A small inconvenience for the plusses of location and luxury. The hotel is a very easy walk from the Rialto bridge and an easy walk in the other direction from St. Mark Square. It is located slightly off the beaten track which makes it quiet while still being very convenient walking distance from most sights and/or the water taxi stops. The breakfast room at Centauro was a wonderful, welcoming experience. Offering cereals, juices, hard eggs, various cold cuts and cheeses, brewed coffee, tea, hot chocolate and assorted Danish and breads, it was a typical serve-yourself, European buffet but offered in a beautifully inviting room with floor to ceiling doors overlooking the canal below. We had beautiful weather in early May and the doors were wide open both mornings we visited and we enjoyed sitting right in front of the doors with a spectacular view of what Venice is known for! The hotel staff was extremely helpful offering maps when requested and holding our suitcases without charge on check-out day until our departure for the airport in the early evening. There is even a lovely sitting/reading area with available computer and restroom on the floor just above reception for relaxing either before or after check in/out. We did have rain one evening and arrived back at the hotel a bit wet and would have loved to be able to make coffee in the room, but alas no in-room coffee makers. A very small complaint and overall we really couldn't have been more pleased. Would definitely stay here again if we are ever blessed to visit Venice a third time!
reviews.title: Great location, overflowing with Venetian charm & hospitality!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Hotel Centauro for 4 nights in a standard double room. We printed off the directional map from the hotels website prior to travelling and followed it very easily to the hotel from the Rialto Bridge. Situated in a very narrow but clean alley/street off a small square with a lion monument, it was out of the way of all the hustle and bustle of the main tourist routes, which was really nice as it gave you the chance to see a bit of the real Venice as apposed to the tourist bit. Very central to all the main attractions (Rialto Bridge, St Marks Square, Accadamia Bridge) All about 5 - 10 min walk away.
reviews.title: Honeymoon in Venice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was continental with a choice of croissants, fruit, yogurt, cereals, rolls and cold meats and cheese and a few little extras like biscuits and crackers, honey etc... plus coffee and tea. Very nice but personally I would have like some of the croissants to not have sugar on them. The breakfast room was very nice with views of a canal.
reviews.title: An old-fashioned Venice hotel
